Reviews.Title: “Stop Over fo 20HRS in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: BlackangusHH
Reviews.Content: 20 Hours must waiting in Dubai Airport , We have Emirates Economy Ticket we dont able to get a Hotel my family with my 12yers older sun we cannot wait in Airport, Thats why i try to make 96Hr.Visa and Hotel , Its too Expensive , better for rest ourselve in Royal Ascot Hotel , very nice accomondation

Reviews.Title: “Good city hotel.”
Reviews.Author: DM787
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in the city that is only a short walk to the busy creek. It is beside a main road so it’s easy to get a taxi to take you anywhere in the city. The rooms are nicely decorated and very clean with large double beds that are very comfortable. There is an extensive room service menu with the food that I had being excellent. The restaurants in the hotel also serve good food with the hotel bar being nice and large with plenty of seating. There is also another Irish theme pub called Waxy's which is good, this is part of the same building as the hotel and frequented by plenty of hotel guests and ex pats with a wide range of drinks. Service at the check in desk was prompt and efficient. All staff I had dealings with were helpful and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel..!!”
Reviews.Author: Tejas_m29
Reviews.Content: Good hotel.. The hotel has a huge lobby with good interiors.The service at the reception was also good.They allowed early check in and late check out..The hotel has many restaurants from indian to lebenase.The room is spacious with good quality of beds and the room was very clean and well maintained.The hotel is located in bur dubai which is almost the centre of dubai so all tourist places are nearby..there are many indian restaurants near the hotel. The most crowd in hotel was indian.Swimming pool was on top floor which was great.The hotel also has an roof top lounge which offers good food and it feel great at night there. Try to get a room facing the main road to get a good view.

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive for nothing”
Reviews.Author: Mohamed Z
Reviews.Content: I have booked this hotel by travel agent only for one night as i couldn't find rooms any other hotel near work due to DSF, the room is very basic and super expensive. i paid 650$ for 1 night, i thought i will be staying in Royal palace....but far away from being. Staff are not friendly and can't understand what you are asking for. also location is bad and very far from any attractions. i don't recommend

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel but a bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: RAJIVMARAWAR
Reviews.Content: a along with my family stayed in the hotel from 19 th jan to 22 nd jan 2012.very good hotel.prompt service,kind and helping staff.food from indian restaurant bollywood was very tasty and enjoyable.liquor was very costly.room ambience was good and rooms were spacious.very near to indian restaurants like kamat,marwari,mini punjab ,udupi etc.indian breakfast was nice and had so many dishes along with fruits,dry fruits,egg prep;chicken ,sausages etc. overall a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad..”
Reviews.Author: Mayberlynn
Reviews.Content: Overall a nice & standard hotel..comfortable bed & pillow..Not bad...:)

Reviews.Title: “It's a shame about the shower!”
Reviews.Author: rwgansley
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights after a trip to Hong Kong and Laos, the intention was to chill out after 16 hectic days. We were able to chill out, the room was very spacious with a comfortable bed and black-out curtains. The breakfast could not be faulted, great variety and friendly service. The hotel is ideally situated for exploring old Dubai, a short walk from the soukhs and the Creek. The nearby Dubai museum is well worth a visit, not in any way "stodgy". We resisted the temptation to use the in-house restaurants and discovered "Mama's",which was a 5 minute walk away. The food was South and North Indian, with Chinese thrown in for good measure. We ate there every night, fantastic value,quality food and first rate service. I did use the Irish Bar "Waxy's", but not often, thirteen or so lagers,Kilkenny Bitter,Guinness and Strongbow were on draught but at 32 dirhams a pint (£6 ish) a bit on the prohibitive side. Go on Wednesday night and roll the dice with the bar tender for a free pint! I did and won 2 pints! Now for the negatives. We had stayed in 10 hotels in the days leading up to our stay at the Royal Ascot, all of them provided free WiFi, tea/coffee making facilities in the bedroom and HOT water in the shower. The Royal Ascot failed on all three counts. I suppose the WiFi and the tea/coffee you can manage without but TEPID showers cannot be excused. I did report the lack of hot water on two occasions but the situation did not improve. We shall look elsewhere the next time we pass through Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: offroaders2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very good one in Bur Dubai. Very close to the airport and very well connected by Dubai Tube. Can find all the renowned shopping malls nearby. Meena Bazar is just opposite to the Hotel. This property is really favourite with the Indians travelling to UAE. Nice neat and clean Hotel. Good rooms. The buffet breakfast is very wholesome with so many choices and food is also exceptionally good. Nearby to the Hotel one can find various Indian Restaurants incase you want to try outside food.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location & Service,Slightly Higher Pricing”
Reviews.Author: Jiten1969
Reviews.Content: Stay here regularly since 2006 and enjoy every bit.Right from their location in Bur Dubai ...10 mins drive from the airport to being opposite the Mina Bazaar,to a 5 minute walk to the aabra station its location is indeed convenient.Rooma are spacious and their breakfast is a welcome spread for one and all.They do have other luxurious options but haven't used them for want of time.Always feel that they could reduce a bit on their pricing though.Have had issues with them twice in the past wherein was charged for the bar-menu although i didn't use anything.The lobby manager Mr. Raghunath was kind enough to hear me out and reverse the charges.Only grouse is their check-in which takes a long time and guests are not accomodated before check-in time even though the room would be vacant.I recommend this hotel to business travellers and those on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money hotel in Bur Dubai”
Reviews.Author: BarryUno
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Ascot Hotel wihch is right next door a few times in the past, we decided to try its big brother, the Royal Ascot. Apart from slightly larger rooms and better furnishings, it was pretty much the same. Good service, good ameneties and a good array of restaurants if you count the ones in the Ascot. The hotel is located in the middle of Bur Dubai which is under 10 minutes away from Sheikh Zayed road and about 20 - 25 minites from the airport. The other ameneties like room service, housekeeping are pretty good. If you're into pool, they have a game room which isn't the best but it's quite all right and if you're lucky, the guy there might just join you for a game or two (on the house). There is a spa and a Turkish bath but unfortuinately although we were told that the rooftop pool was temperature controlled when we checked in, we found out that it wasn't which was a disappointment. The other disappointment was there was an Irish bar which we liked but they served regular food (unlike the pub grub we were expecting) like nachos and fajitas. Overall, I'd say the hotel was good and would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Cerini2001
Reviews.Content: Huge room, all very clean, tidy and well appointed, but overall the property does lack character and the myriad of restaurants within the property is slightly off putting (but handy if stopping over for business or on the way somewhere else. The hotel is located right on the new Metro train service which is brilliant, not far from the airport, and you can get pretty much anywhere in Dubai quickly and easily, and cheaply from the front door. There are a couple of good shopping malls within walking distance and Emirates and Dubai Malls are 10 mins away on the metro - easy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: sarbSiliguri
Reviews.Content: Excellent Accomodation...excellent value for money. Nice ambience and very helpful staff. The decor and the interiors are just perfect and gives a traveller a total utility. Good value for money.Recommend this hotel for stays.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location & great facilities”
Reviews.Author: t112p
Reviews.Content: Travelled with family Sept 2011 to Dubai. Been before and wanted to see some of the newer attractions. We were initially booked into the sister hotel The Ascot, but on checking-in, were informed their pool was undergoing maintenance work so would not be accessiblt during our stay. Told the manager we wanted to use the pool, so he transferred us to Royal Ascot without much fuss. This had rooftop pool - which most of the time was specially opened for us, as not many people use it. Had gym and sauna facilities too. Breakfast was great. Hot indian food available as well as regular english breakfast option. The apartments are well sized. Only down size, if you ask for 3 people in one apartment, one room has a double bed, and they put another single bed into the living room. The kitchen is equipped with just enough plates/cutlery for 2 people, so have to ask for more - but they are more than helpful in getting it for you. Room cleaned daily. Hotel is alking distance from Meena Bazaar, so great for if you want to go shopping and eat out as all shops and restaurants local.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but be selective”
Reviews.Author: SJAIRATH
Reviews.Content: The hotel runs 4 night clubs which will be noisy. The location is amazing with shopping options within walkable distance. Breakfast is too good with Indian option. Healthclub, steam and sauna are also well maintained. I stayed in a huge room with a small kitchen. The stay was comfortable but was slightly expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: SadhanaEdvankar
Reviews.Content: Extremely good hotel, in a very convenient location. The breakfast here is awesome. The room was very spacious & clean, beds were comfortable. Only thing missing was that there was no tea/coffee maker(kettle) in the room which was a little inconvienent, but I would not mind visiting and staying in this hotel during my next visit to Dubai. I give i a thumbs up...I enjoyed my stay in Royal Ascot.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: sham55
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and the staff always happy to help and had a smile on. One in particular was Jerry, he was very helpful, i was there with my family and one member is wheelchair bound. The hotel is not fully accessible but if you can walk a little with aids its a brilliant place to go to. My son could not go into the bathroom as it was too narrow and to go by the pool there is a little step, this did not stop us from going as the staff were happy to help lift the wheelchair in. It has good choice of restaurants within, there was a big choice of breakfast and if you are a vegetarian you would not go hungry as there is ample to choose from. The hotel is very local to the shops, metro station and malls. I would go to this hotel again and recommend it.highly, four star hotel with five star service!!

Reviews.Title: “Royal Ascot - I really dont think it is a 5 star hotel, but enjoyed being there!”
Reviews.Author: VaniaBrazil_11
Reviews.Content: It is located in Bur Dubai and in what they call the Finance Area of Dubai. Across the hotel there are several stores that sell computers and its accessories. But, walking in the streets behind the main street, we found lots of little shops selling indian outfits, jewelry, beauty salons etc The hotel itself has several restaurants: a Russian (excellent!!), a Lebanese (that almost caused me a heart attack the night we arrived, since they put us in a room on the top of it and after a 15 hours flight we could not sleep till 3am, when the show and the banging music finished!!- YES, they have the show everyday or a lot, I guess. SOOO, ask for a room as far as possible from this restaurant!!), an Indian, a Japanese, A Thai/Chinese, a Steak Place (very good with a very good deal for steak and wine for lunch) etc - I could say that out of the dinner we had at the Burj Al Arab hotel, the food served at Royal Ascot was the best we had in Dubai, especially in the Russian Restaurant... After trying a lot of places, we decided to dine at the hotel! Taxis in Dubai are not expensive and they are metered. So, it is very easy to go everywhere in town from our hotel. Subway is not complicated either. The hotel also offers a free daily shuttle to Jumeirah beach, which the Burj Al Arab and beaches are located. The breakfast is OK, nothing really exceptional about it. You have to pay to use the internet (no matter if in your room or in business center), and I wouldnt say it is cheap, but, not that expensive either. They dont REALLY have non-smoking rooms. For sure people smoked (and a lot) in both rooms they assigned to us at the hotel. We changed the first one because the Lebanese show and also, because of the heavy smell of tobacco. It was a little better in the second one, but yet, smelled. Overall, it was good for the price we paid!

Reviews.Title: “Most staff lackadaisical, the rest I'm not sure about”
Reviews.Author: Tilt-scale-gyro
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked our stayed here for three days. We asked for a quiet room (other reviewers had complained it could be noisy) but we didn't get one. It was however not the fault of the hotel. It was our misfortune to pick a time when road works were being carried out, right outside the hotel. The time they choose to do such repairs was when the road are at their quietest, which is in the early hours. A quieter room would have been at the rear of the hotel away from the main road. Oh well. When we arrived, we left our luggage in the hands of a bell boy and checked in. After this we were shown to our room which was right opposite the lifts. The expected noise normally associated with such locations never materialised, but our luggage did, in good time. Not only was it all there but there was an additional plastic bag mostly full of cans of Fosters lager. "That's not ours", I said. "I don't remember whose it is", he said. After some scratching of heads, he asked if he could leave it in our room while he tried to find the owner. About fifteen minutes later he returned saying he had no idea who they belonged to and then offered them to us, three times. "They're not ours", I said each time, suggesting he look for a recently arrived Australian. Was all this genuine or was he trying to pull of some sort of scam, I know not, maybe you do? Our room was a good size and everything we expected, clean, big television, comfortable beds, decent bathroom etc. Our first night there coincided with our wedding anniversary, so being on there on a B&B basis and not wanting to search for somewwhere to eat, we decided at the Korean restaurant on the ground floor after an excellent pint in the bar. The actual ordering took a long time and the staff weren't really interested in dealing with us, there were after all, several groups of (I assume) Koreans already eating there. Now I don't mind a little bit of spiciness in my food but my wife doesn't, so we told them this. The starters were great and the BBQ OK, but the casserole had a chilli floating in it. I fished this out and tasted it. "Not too bad " I told my wife, however she thought it was hot and so I looked for more chillis. I found another seven(7). After two mouthfuls she had had enough and even I struggled to make a dent in the generous portion. What a waste of otherwise good food. Unless you like really spicy hot food, I don't recommend eating here. On the last day we took advantage of the 110 AED deal of steak and half a bottle of wine in the Wellington bar. I had the rack of lamb and my wife the steak. Both were really good although we weren't asked what type of potates we wanted (got chips). About a third of the way through I had to go to the bar and ask for the wine. "Oh you want it now" is what I got, Well "yes please". The swimming pool is on the roof and very pleasant with a great view. On our final day, our ride to the airport was going to leave before breakfast. "Not a problem", we were assured at reception. They took our wake up time and breakfast order the evening before. The wake up call was ten minutes early and the breakfast hadn't arrived as we left the room, half an hour after the time it was ordered for. "Oh", is all we got at reception when we checked out. Perhaps we shouild have booked a room only deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: BASISPRADHAN82
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 days. It was a business trip but I also managed it as a vacation trip. 4 star property. Great location. Good number of restaurants and all of them are speciality ones. You will end up liking some restaurant. Must stay I will say.

Reviews.Title: “DONT STAY HERE!!”
Reviews.Author: Wozer123
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to this hotel but was very very let down. I arrived late, tired and just wanting to sleep. This is were i came across my first problem.. If you want a hotel where u can sleep then don't choose here.. I was on the 6th floor and all I could here was banging music. I never complain about anything and usually just get on with it but at 3am I'd had enough. I went to reception to see what was going on and the guy said theres no clubs / bars playing music in the hotel. I explained I could here loud music though. His response was..' it is probably the nightclub next door but you can't hear it on the 6th floor.. I politely told him I can hear it. To which he responsed ' yeh but you shouldn't be able to'. I was getting no where with this guy so went back to bed. The staff are generally friendly apart from the receptionists who are very rude. Huffed when I asked for my passport back? Which they took and never gave me back on check in. The room was ok.. Thats it just ok.. Never in a million years is this hotel a 4star. I expected a lot more and was disappointed. The bathroom was falling to bits and don't think you can shower in this hotel because you can't.. The water pressure is awful. Just a trickle. There is no free wi-fi which I was astonished at. I had backpacked around Indonesia before arriving in Dubai and every hotel, bar , restaurant offered free wi-fi. This hotel charges a fortune for an hour. I was only staying a couple of nights thankfully and couldn't wait to check out. The only good thing about this hotel is the breakfast which caters for most people and has a good range. Will never stay here again and I will do my most to male sure the tour operator I booked with stops using this hotel.. STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is where the action is in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: atw1946
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 3.00 am from the UK & could not believe the amount of people outside the Hotel all nationalities with Taxis- 4 x4 -Large Luxury cars Etc I thought it was a fire alarm or something No these were just guests coming & going from the many night clubs & restaurants in the Hotel Once in the reception everthing seem quiet normal / bedrooms / bathrooms Etc as quoted & shown on the net / brochures No view overlooked a busy 24 /7 road But it was fine as was the location of the hotel for the three days of exploring a very busy Dubai We started with the open top bus tour about a 10 minute walk from the Hotel Suggest a Two day ticket RED tour One day BLUE the next Did not do the night tour too tired We tried some of Hotel Restaurants Chinese OK -- Steak / Grill --Irish -- Lebonase All up standard & not as expensive as we had thought London Prices for food / Alchol well be careful breakfast served in a night club was only average Dubai is a fun place 4 days /3 nights was ample to see most things Prices in the shops for normal type clothing ie M/S seem about 10 to 15 % higher cannot comment on Designer Labels as we are not aware of UK prices BUT Food /Coffees / soft drinks very reasonable when you consider where you are quality excellant along with service of western type food / drinks operations Going back to the Hotel its a base staff very friendly would stop again

Reviews.Title: “Average - not bad but not good”
Reviews.Author: xyz49
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I was expecting a 5 star hotel. Turns out it isn't. Don't get me wrong this isn't a particularly bad hotel but its old and is aging. The restaurants were empty most nights we went there however the food in the Wellington bar was lovely. The food in the Thai restaurant wasn't nice and the Indian restaurant was bizarre - it had women lined up dancing and the music was very loud. Location is ok as its near the hop on/hop off tour bus which is good. Its a bus ride to the beach though so beware. Staff were ok but gave me incorrect information about opening times of a local museum. All in all ok but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: roxan_patel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very ideally situated ,right in the heart of Bur Dubai. The breakfast layout was incredible.Great value for the money we pay for. Loooooved the fruity yoghurt they serve .....simply delicious!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I am a regular visitor to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ami14
Reviews.Content: I visit Dubai so often to Dubai for my business trips. I have stayed at so many hotels, but this one is my favourite.You can't find a more neat and clean business hotel than this one in Dubai. Infact, I have found this hotel fully occupied even in the off season.The location is so good and It's so easy to go anywhere. Staff is very polite and ever helpful. The breakfast is fine too.I would say this hotel is total value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for our one night stay”
Reviews.Author: stelle-89
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night after a tour in the UK. Arrived at about 9:30-10 am and had been told we would have early check in after our overnight flight. Unfortunately, after waiting for an hour, we still had no rooms and decided to hire a driver and go for a drive around a quick city tour of Dubai. This quick tour took about an hour and after this came back and our rooms were finally ready. The room itself was fine, clean and the bathroom was nice. The lobby was as very nice. Breafast was included and had a decent selection. I probably wouldn't choose this hotel if I went back but only based on location. There is a hotel car and taxis available for very cheap prices though, so overall would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Yuki2703
Reviews.Content: This hotel was gorgeous. We were fortuante enough to have our room upgraded to a suite, it even had a kichenette. The room was fantastic and huge! It was very clean. The bed was excellent, big and soooooo comfy. The staff were lovely, helpful and very attentive. The hotel in general was just beautiful, it had everything you could want. You could just stay in the hotel no need to go out anywhere as they had everything. ie 24 hour cafe, different restaurants, pool etc. Breakfast was included and it was great! Yummy and fresh, they even cooked omelettes to order and they were YUM! The one negative was you had to pay for internet usage. All in all we would absolutely stay there again, very up market.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel..”
Reviews.Author: PetoMaj
Reviews.Content: Stayed 8 nights on business, by Dubai measures probably rather a small hotel - but for me an excellent choice. drive time from airport some 20 mins, Jumeira open beach 10 mins away by taxi. Polite staff, super clean, decent sized rooms, 8 floors but some 5 restaurants. quick check in/out - great pool at the roof top with a bar. Only minus is cost of the Internet (60 dirhams = 12 gbp a day! ) at the room; - but its free by the pool at the roof top. Overall an excellent choice

Reviews.Title: “2 Star at best, not for families with young children, rude staff”
Reviews.Author: spursdon
Reviews.Content: On arrival was quite impressed with the hotel as i had my reservations. Check-in was painless and we were shown to our roon. We travelled with a 4 year old and a 1 and a half year old. They quickly setup the extra bed and cot for the kids. Some staff were very nice and friendly with the kids, others just looked like they were smiling through gritted teeth and were on a power trip. We had an issue with the breakfast manager who took objection to us taking 2 bread rolls for the kids who did not eat at the table, and was told there are international rules to follow, and if everyone did it then there would be no breakfast left for others! Must be different in dubai than the rest of the world where kids are treated like kids and given exception and breakfast even sent to rooms after. On checking out was asked if had used anything from mini-bar told them no, they still sent someone to the room who entered whilst my wife was getting changed. There noisy club next door played music into the small hours, and getting out of the taxi outside was a nightmare, each time nearly getting runover. Hotel tries to be 4-5 star but the staff and service let it down badly.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best, most staff aren't friendly, would not recommend for families.”
Reviews.Author: jass273
Reviews.Content: I arrived and felt a bit un-easy, receptionists rushed me through, interior of the lobby was good, had 4 elevators so didn't have to wait for long. The rooms were standard, small size, small bathroom, but all was clean!, so I was OK. Not happy that the cleaner used my toilet n didn't wipe the seat though. Good range of facilities, a few different restaurants, and a cafe, one restaurant stood out, as I thought I had taken my mum n sister to a Indian restaurant in the hotel, but it was apparent after the music n dance started that it was definitely not the sort of place we should of went, it was verging on a gentlemans club, with punters all tucking money down the tarts tops! Why the manager never thought to tell me knowing I was with my family is beyond me. VERY DISAPPOINTED. easily the best feature was the chill bar on the roof, friendly staff, especially the manageress who you could effortlessly hold a convo with, n bar staff with a good sense of humour. OUTSIDE There's no getting away from the men employed to entice you into stores, or alleys to make you buy fake branded items, to say I kept my cool would be a lie. Lovely restaurants in the area if you can find them, particularly a Punjabi restaurant about 5 mins away at most, low prices and better food than the restaurant in the hotel. The closest foreign exchange was around 5mins away n easy to get to, just take a right as you leave n keep going. the view from the roof at night is stunning, perfect view of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Room and Comfort”
Reviews.Author: Steven1969
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after reading reviews on Tripadvisor. I was sadly disappointed. I stayed in Room 650 and I was disappointed with the quality of the room. The room was small and worse still someone had used the bathroom and not flushed the toilet and the bed looked like someone had been sitting on it. There were some tissues in the dustbin that had not been cleared away. The room had a kitchenette area with a fridge-freezer but no tea/coffee facilities and no complimentary bottled water. There was wireless internet available but at extra cost - I have no idea why hotels expect guests to pay for this service. The bathroom was small and the toilet was difficult to get to as it was behind the bathroom door. There was no separate shower and there were no toiletries to speak of provided in the bathroom. I was told that I would get a complimentary newspaper but none was provided even though I saw them outside other guest rooms. Breakfast was good, with a selection of meals available. Service was reasonable but no pleasantries or smiles evident from the staff working there. My room was meant to be charged directly to my company but the hotel claimed they had no paperwork. Several calls later, they finally accepted that the bill would be charged to the company but at check-out, I was again told that I would need to pay for my room - this was eventually resolved but left me feeling quite annoyed. The location of the hotel was good but I am unlikely to stay here again because of the poor quality of the bedroom and the cleanliness issues.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: ree786
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 5 nights and enjoyed evry minute. The only down fault was breakfast closes too early as u on holiday and can't wake up tht early. Pls look int o tht coz thts the only reason won't com bk. But overall lovd it. Spa was lovely nd the chill bar on rooftop was great. Thumbs up!!!

Reviews.Title: “Close to discount shops n budget eateries & comfy stay”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELMANA
Reviews.Content: Hi, Royal Ascot is actually a very comfortable family hotel with various well done rooms n suites. The best part about the hotel as per me would be its location. It is situated on Khalid Bin Walid Street, one of the prime roads of Bur Dubai. But what matters more is that it is just opposite many discount shops (Seventh Heaven, Green, Carrefour) and also Indian restaurants (Vasantam, Udipi hotels, Thalssery, etc). This is a big advantage if you are looking out to buy a lot of souvenirs and bulk shopping for essentials. It is opposite the local computer and technological-related item shops like Sharif , etc for the latest updates on the electronic market (mobiles, cameras). The Burjuman Mall, Karama, is close by for the brand conscious and the Gold Souk Deira is also near for all the dazzle shopping. The breakfast spread was adequate with English, continental, Indian and Arabic food to choose from. The breakfast tables were always full implying that the hotel was well occupied during our visit. But then the Dubai Shopping Festival was on during that period so I guess that explains the high occupancy rate. The housekeeping, restaurant and the reception staff were coordial and prompt in their responses. There are also lots of World cuisine restaurants in the hotel like Korean, Russian, Indian, Arabic, etc. They also have a beauty parlor and Spa Massage facility. Internet is chargeable which was not cool. The pool was on the rooftop but we couldn't enjoy it though. They also have a night club which appeared to be crowded whenever we returned late in the night. It is a very nice hotel but didn't spend much time in the hotel to enjoy its facilities much. We did avail of the complimentary drop at the airport though. I would definitely stay at the Royal Ascot on my next visit to Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay, huge rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sak14
Reviews.Content: Would definitely recommend this hotel. Rooms are spacious esp. ones ofered to us as we had got an upgraded room without any extra charge, location is near Meena Bazar and located in Bur Dubai. Internet Charges are high but pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “would stay in this hotel again during my next trip”
Reviews.Author: nermala
Reviews.Content: i booked into this hotel during my short 3 day trip to dubai on jan 30th. they upgraded my room to the suite without extra charges. the room was very spacious, clean and classy. the front desk staff were very helpful and the location of this hotel is so near to many tourist location in dubai. the morning breakfast was equally good. would recommend this hotel to anybody who is not on a tight budget and travelling to dubai

Reviews.Title: “excellent hospitality, good care, neat and hygenic, and very nice food”
Reviews.Author: Anvar69
Reviews.Content: nice and safe place for family stay. home away from home. keep it up

Reviews.Title: “Very big room and bathroom”
Reviews.Author: rjasmin
Reviews.Content: Really happy with the room and bathroom also comes with a bidet. Only get to taste the international buffet breakfast, which is satisfactory. Love the smoked salmon that they served though. The hotel also has a rooftop swimming pool and bar.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Travel during Ramadan”
Reviews.Author: sagwanderer
Reviews.Content: The our rooms where up graded us to a beautiful to 2 bedroom apartment 2 bathrooms and kitchen....only problem the kitchen was bare no plates cups or sauces not even a kettle/jug .....extremely sad... the noise from the mosques would wake you in the morning if you left the windows opened, we where not subjected to any other noises the staff where very accommodating. It was the older part of town and I did go out by my self to the corner store so to speak late in the evening and felt quiet safe. The motel has a lot of charm ... we had fun and ate in, on three occasions and food was very good.

Reviews.Title: “A superb hotel at the heart of dubai”
Reviews.Author: Sudhiraca
Reviews.Content: The royal ascot is a 4 star hotel in Bur Dubai, Dubai. It has got a very good location for business travellers and also for shoppers. For people seeking entertainment, its 4 night clubs will keep you entertained from Indian Bollywood to Russian to Arabic style. Its also has a sports bar, a english style bar, a koran and a thai restaurant. Planet bollywood serves some very good indian dinner amongst the singing and dancing of indian artists. The hotel has a nice spa and swimming pool with a good gym. The room service is good and the staff are friendly. A must try for travellers to Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “good but you can get better”
Reviews.Author: gopalmarda
Reviews.Content: the rooms are big and the decor nice.........but somehow had lot of problem with the room key which never seem to work in one go and we had swipe it atleast 10 times to go through.........the staff is helpful and for an indian ......good veg options

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE THAT S”
Reviews.Author: travelstandby
Reviews.Content: we travelled to dubai and we booked the dubai's best hotel its Hotel Royel Ascot, Dubai. We travelled many more place but i like the most is the Hotel Royal Ascot in Dubai. the hotel where can we relaxed and enjoy the travel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you like to sleep before 3.30am”
Reviews.Author: PoppyStaff
Reviews.Content: The music from the various clubs and restaurants can be heard on every floor until gone 3am. My complaints to the reception staff were ignored. The music actually got louder after making the complaints. I will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: hellofawoman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel 4-8/3-10. Had some problems with luggage that was late. Staff helped us to get it back. Nice atmosphere, peaceful. Breakfast was ok. And neck/back massage was wonderful, tried twice!

Reviews.Title: “rude reception”
Reviews.Author: Jackie061
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed with the hotel reception and concierge staff. Very rude and not at all helpful. Would not stay again or recommend

Reviews.Title: “Bad Bad Bad”
Reviews.Author: hitkaiser
Reviews.Content: The Bad: You won't be able to sleep until 3.30am due to the loud music produced by the club downstairs - every day of the week. The Good: Rooms were good. My recommendation, there are plenty of hotels in the area and you don't have to put up with the noise of having so much noise every night.

Reviews.Title: “Dubai”
Reviews.Author: AndrewP5
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable and excellent service, in the heart of downtown Dubai and most amenities within a short walk or taxi ride

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in bur dubai”
Reviews.Author: alok_chowhan
Reviews.Content: i visited dubai on 28 th dec and stayed till till 1st jan 2010. During my 4 days visit i have seen full hotel and it is very good, clean and neat. Reception and lounge is very good.Elevators are good and clean.staff is very helpfull. I met Mr GAURAV and Mr Farooq during my breakfast time , they were handling customers efficiently. mannerisms ,rooms, bathrooms are upto the mark. restaurants, cafeteria provide sumptuous food with varied delicacies. i recommend this hotel to all travellers as one of the best hotel in dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not brilliant”
Reviews.Author: alfie50
Reviews.Content: Good hotel well located in Dubai, staff were helpful and friendly

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and combined with arabian adventures and superb!!”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaDebby
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stopped over on route back to Sydney from London, Emirates aranged everything for us with Arabian Adventures, we were met at airport, all our luggage was taken care of, we were taken to the Royal Ascot Hotel, picked up next day for a dune safari, which was fantastic, Rostam and Meryvn took us on a hair raising trip up and down the dunes and then on to the banquet in the desert and camel rides. Then on the last day we were picked up to go back to the airport to fly out. Being woman alone we were dubious but no need to have been, we were wonderfully taken care of. We just wished now that we had stayed longer. The Royal Ascot Hotel was wonderful and the breakfast was delightful. We recommend this to anyone going to dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed several times now and always happy with it.”
Reviews.Author: annadhubh
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel several times now. Its right in the city and just a short walk to the creek or cheap taxi ride away from everything. Staff are helpful and courteous and the rooms are spotless with nice big beds. Although in the middle of the city they have a deal with another hotel where you can get a transfer to their beach. The only negative I would have is that the Russian bar in the hotel can have pretty loud music playing until the early hours. It wont bother you if your going to be there yourself but may be worth asking for a room away from it if your after an early night.

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD LOCATION and Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ISHANIKA
Reviews.Content: Royal Ascot is situated on Khalid bin Waleed road in Bur Dubai.It is a very central location and is walking distance to Meena Bazar and close to the airport.It is an ideal location if you are visiting Dubai for the first time. The only drawback is the size of Bathroom which is really small for a 4 star.As you open the door from inside your hand may get stuck between the granite basin and the door which is rather painful Also make sure to get a room away from the disco to be able to sleep peacefully. Apart from that it is good with a nice breakfast spread as well On the whole "Value for Money "

Reviews.Title: “Staying in Royal Ascot equals to a great experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: karafilp
Reviews.Content: Everything was great...The room was very clean and impressive ,the staff was very friendly and helpful and finally the breakfast was rich in taste and choices!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but low Service Standards”
Reviews.Author: dsheth88
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend stayed at this hotel for 4 days and we found this hotel excellent. The properrty is damn good with its large rooms and cleanliness. the only problem is the staff is not up to the mark but the hotel infra made us forget this. It has all the things which a 5 star hotel deserves but the service standards.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, indifferent service, overall not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: blohot
Reviews.Content: stayed for a week with my family. Since I was forewarned about the noise from the disco, I asked specifically for a room on the higher floors and facing away from the main street. I got a room at the end of the 7th floor. I am glad to say that the room was very quiet with absolutely no disturbance of any kind. The housekeeping was unobtrusive and competent. I was somewhat stuck by the indifferent attitude of the girls in the reception. While not being rude, they were certainly not warm or friendly and did not seem to offer much assistance. In fact on most questions, they seemed ignorant. The rooms themselves were clean, the water pressure good and the bed comfy. My only grouse was that inspite of the individual AC controls in the room, the aircon seemed to have a mind of its own. It was freezing during the afternoons and strangely warm during the nights. I had to manually crank up the aircon in the middle of the night. The breakfast was unremarkable and par for a hotel of this class. The best part of the hotel was its location, very much in the heart of Bur Dubai and walking distance from the abra station from where you can cross over to Deira and the souks. Plenty of inexpensive eateries including indian vegetarian restaurants within walking distance. Overall I would definitely go back here. I paid an average of 100 USD per night which was pretty decent all things compared. Wish they had shuttle services to the malls which was missed, as well as complimentary pickup/drop to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you want to sleep”
Reviews.Author: cooljunk2
Reviews.Content: If you want to sleep at night, avoid this hotel! There is a dance club located on the ground floor of this hotel, and you can literally "feel" the rhythm of techno music on your bed until dusk. It seems that the whole structure of the hotel was vibrating and I couldn't sleep even with earplugs on. The girls at the reception desk were very cold and smileless. Having said that the room was relatively clean and food was not bad. Unless you won't come back to the hotel until 4 in the morning, stay away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Two Thumbs Up !”
Reviews.Author: RoozbeH
Reviews.Content: Before reserving this hotel ... i read all the reviews and got a mixed feeling about it ..but since i was given a great deal from my travel agent and saw good feedbacks i gave it a shot ... i payed around 100$ for a single room per night ...and i assure u the thing i got was way beyond what i payed for there are two hotels sticked together one is the ascot which is 3star and the Royal Ascot which is a 4star, some services are shared by these two like the buffet lunch ( which was included on my room since it was Half Board) ...the hotels have Thai/Chinese,Arabic,Korean,Russian,Japanese restaurants and a grill and bar .the breakfast was great almost any thing you can think of,the roof top was a heaven ... sports club,massage and a bar/lounge which has a live DJ at nights with shisha/drinks and dinner at nights with a great view of Dubai.rooms were very clean and comfy and room serviced did their job every day.friendly staff at the reception but a bit lazy because i needed a cork screw for my wine which i asked twice but later bought it from across the street !! the only thing which really pissed me of was INTERNET ...very expensive (40 Dirhams~12 USD per hour) and even if you use it for five mins they would charge you for the whole hour)..and check your bill with great attention since they usually charge you for what you haven't used from the mini bar ...i told them about the drinks i hadn't used and they removed it from my bill with no hustle! overall .. great place in center of the city .... definitly i would go back !

Reviews.Title: “Below average, wouldnt pay for it”
Reviews.Author: c01d
Reviews.Content: There are two hotels owned by this group, the Ascot and the Royal Ascot. I stayed at the Royal, the Ascot is supposed to be dire. Pretty average, attention to detail is lacking. Both phones in the room were programmed with incorrect numbers for reception and room service etc. The music from the club next door penetrates the hotel, and the windows don't dampen street noise. Left a jumper in the airport transfer van, never saw it again, Not the most professional or confidence inspiring introduction to the hotel. Company paid for the hotel, it has its flaws, but in comfortable enough. Internet is pretty slow for Dubai. There are plenty of better hotels in Dubai, avoid this place if you can.

Reviews.Title: “- Situated in the Heart of Dubai”
Reviews.Author: shrinivaskhanolkar
Reviews.Content: Damn good hotel, right in the heart of Dubai. Situated in Bur Dubai, the hotel is just about 15 mins drive from the airport. Being very close to the old commercial hub in the city, the night comes alive. what best most gazetic shops are just around the corner. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Only Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: macbey
Reviews.Content: This was my worst trip to dubai and the hotel made it complete. To be honest There was no pool! No sport club ! No music club! first night was terrible because i was staying in 4th floor and there was still noise raising from ELEGANT disco. the next night i have tried to attend in but gards didnt let hotel resident in!!!and asked for reservation in club!!! the room was complete and no problem in rooms car and transport was good. This hotel needs modifications and organization. so far 3 star is enough for ROYAL ascot hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't eat at Troika restaurant”
Reviews.Author: SuperMissG
Reviews.Content: We went there to celebrate a friend's birthday . The music is good and the show is ok, but whatever good thing could have the place is tarnished by the "security staff" attitude. We were 30 people and the bill was way too big for what we consumed. It was a very bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “exel ent time i ever spent with my family i would love to visit dubai again and”
Reviews.Author: appuu
Reviews.Content: the best i ever had .Never seen so much courtsy in any other hotel so far.i would love to visit again to dubai and stay in the same property royal ascot .

Reviews.Title: “Negatives outweigh the positives”
Reviews.Author: sharijono
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked by the company we came to visit and unfortunately this hotel negatives outweigh the positives resulting in me avoiding this hotel for future visits. Pros: rooms are quite large and adequately air-conditioned, large bathroom with good water pressure, friendly and knowledgeable concierge. Convenient location to the Dubai Museum area and in driving range of some of the major malls. Smoking rooms (I was unfortunately appointed one and could not be relocated to a non smoking room) are not too smelly and I as a non smoker was not really bothered by it. Turn down service with a complimentary fruit platter (bananas, apples, grapes and oranges). Cons: noise from the next door night club can be heard, even on the 6th floor and won't stop until around 3AM. Check in/ Checkout agents are very inefficient; it took us about 40 minutes to check out (there was no queue; this was the actual time it took to get checked out). There were items on the bill that could not be explained by the check out agent (we did not use the mini bar, but the hotel insisted that it was a charge for the mini bar). In total the bill was printed out about 5 or 6 times, each time mistakes were made and the bill needed to be reprinted. In the end we missed our flight check in deadline with about 5 minutes and we mainly blame this on the long check out process. When we had to find a hotel to stay in until our next flight, we did not think twice and checked in to the Hilton Dubai Jumeirah: what a difference it was! So save yourself the potential troubles ahead and avoid this hotel which has the potential to be a decent hotel, but at this stage is certainly no more than an average 3 star hotel with inadequate staff (except for the concierge staff).

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: ritafant
Reviews.Content: We had three days in February 2008 (and 4 days last year, same month). The location is very good, in Bur Dubai, within walking distance(about 15/20 minutes) of Creek, Gold Market and Souks. The bedroom was really nice, new, clean and comfortable , lovely bathroom. There is a nice swimmingpool on the roof top with sun loungers . Negative: the buffet breakfast was served in the lobby, near the reception, and food was not good, no fresh eggs and omelettes (breakfast was better last year, served at Troika restaurant in the next door Ascot hotel, more various food and better quality) All in all great value for money

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it !”
Reviews.Author: Gaurav_Vedi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located within the heart of Bur Dubai and is central to almost everything in Dubai. The room we stayed at was small but nice, it was on the 1st floor and there was no view of anything outside, however since there is so much to do at Dubai, this can be ignored. The problem is with so many restaurants in the hotel and there is load music that goes on till 3am and this is extremely disturbing. There is a very small pool and gym at the roof top. It is a substandard 3 star – nothing more. Stay here only if you dont have a choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: skusderci
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are currently staying at the Royal Ascot for business in Dubai. Normally we travel at least once a month, this is our monthly business trip; we choose the Royal Ascot as a result of the website, and the fact that this was a hotel that claimed to be a 5 star. IT IS NOT BY ANY MEANS!! The service is very frustrating to say the least, each morning we've ordered breakfast in our room, and each order has been wrong or missing half of the items. Sorry just doesn't seem to cut it when you're expecting 5 star service/quality. The bathrooms in the main reception were completely trashed the other day, as a result of a huge party of tourists that had to use these to "shower" before leaving to fly home. When I complained about having to walk through a puddle to use the bathrooms, and lift my trousers to avoid stepping in what might be urine and water mixed together was horrifying, again, this IS NOT A 5 STAR HOTEL! Room service takes over an hour for breakfast, we requested our laundry this morning at 9:00 from the previous day, it's now 12:15 and still no sign of our clothes. Next time we'll be staying at the Palace, as the service there is as close to a 5 star as possible. We'd rate this hotel as a 3 star at most. The staff at the front desk are extremelly rude, in any other 5 star hotel they bend over backwards to make sure you're comfortable. We ordered a ironing board and iron for our room, and the ironing board they sent up had black marks all over it, we were told to take a sheet off the bed and cover the board with this!! Does this sound like a 5 star to you??? Ha, hardly! Save your money and stress levels and book someplace else! P.S. No CD players, no DVD players, the radio on the TV's does not work, and every morning we wake up to the smell of garlic meat cooking. I truly can't wait to check out of this sham of a hotel. A veteran traveller.

Reviews.Title: “not for us!!”
Reviews.Author: LondonKiran
Reviews.Content: We have been in Dubai 5 times and stayed at many 5 star Hotels. On this occasion after an recommendation we chose to stay at the Royal Ascot Hotel. When we arrived we asked to have a room on the top floor because we knew about the night club noise next door. Anyway the reception desk came back and gave us a room on 1st floor even though we asked for the top floor. After a long wait we finally was moved to the 5th Floor. The service was very slow and we found the Staff not very friendly as everyone seemed busy. Our rooms weren't cleaned to the standard of a 5 star hotel we had to keep calling room service for them to finish the job correctly. The biggest let down was the breakfast room. It was situated right next to the reception area which we found it bizarre with people walking in and out of the main entrance. The staff were not friendly to greet us in the morning and it was constantly busy. Staff had no idea where to find a table for us it was ridiculous. It is very unlikely we will be going back to the Royal Ascot Hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Royal Ascot Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Khalid Bin Waleed Street | PO Box 115160, Dubai 52555, United Arab Emirates
